main event: On July 7, 1962, Mrs. C.G. reported seeing a bright white-blue light over Northridge, Ohio, which hovered for 2-3 minutes before accelerating to the north.
interesting points: The object was described as circular and about the size of a basketball at arm's length., The light made no sound during the observation., The object was first noticed in the southern sky and was at a very high altitude., Mrs. C.G. was the only confirmed witness to this sighting., The case was classified as unidentified due to insufficient evidence.
witness description: Mrs. C.G., who saw the object from her residence.
